titleStmt.title: A discouerie and batterie of the great fort of vnwritten traditions otherwise, an examination of the Counsell of Trent, touching the decree of Traditions. Done by Martinus Chemnitius in Latine, and translated into Englishe by R.V.
Examen Concilii Tridentini. English. Selections.
titleStmt.author: Chemnitz, Martin, 1522-1586.
Vaux, Robert.
Cranmer, Thomas, 1489-1556. A confutation of unwritten verities.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Thomas Purfoot, and William Pounsonbie,

notesStmt.note: In two parts. Part 1 is an English translation by Robert Vaux from part 1 of Chemnitz, Martin. Examen concilii Tridentini. Part 2 is an edition of Cranmer, Thomas. A confutation of unwritten verities (STC 5996). Register is continuous.
Part 2 title page (M4r) reads: A confutation of vnwritten verities ..
Part 2 title page imprint reads: Imprinted at London by Thomas Purfoote and are to be solde at his shop, without Newgate, ouer-against S. Sepulchers Churche. Anno 1582.
Running title part 1 reads: Chemnicius of traditions.
part 2 identified as STC 5997 on UMI microfilm.
Reproductions of the originals in the Cambridge University Library (part 1 only) and the Library of Congress (part 2 only).
Appears at reel 211 (Cambridge University Library; part 2 only) and at reel 454 (Library of Congress copy; part 1 only).
